doc.field: Chicagoland, though centered around Chicago, is anchored by many regional cities which have their own distinct cultures, economics and traditions. These are a few of the noteworthy cities and communities in the region: Aurora : Illinoiss second largest city and one of the two anchors of the Fox River Valley , Aurora is a major city and often considered the gateway to the region on I-88. Chicago : The principle city of the region and its main economic engine. Elgin : A historic community and second of the two anchors of the Fox River Valley , Elgin is the gateway to the region on I-90. Joliet : The anchor of the South Suburbs , Joliet is a gateway to the region. Naperville : The primary city of the Western Suburbs , Naperville is often noted for its urban downtown. Waukegan : Birthplace of Ray Bradbury, Waukegan is the anchor of the Far North Suburbs .
